content: The pi.(semi_)normed_* instances are equipped with the supremum norm. Why is the index type restricted to fintype?
otherwise, the topology induced from the norm does not coincide with the product topology?
Jireh Loreaux has marked this topic as resolved.
I assume docs#Pi.topological_space has no such finiteness requirement?

That's right -- in that bare situation there's no competing topology. In Jireh's situation you have norms so two ways to make a topology -- the topology coming from the product norm or the product of the topologies coming from the norms, and you can get different answers in the case where the index type is infinite
Presumably in the infinite case, there is no possible norm that introduces the "right" topology?
It is more subtle than that I think, but true to a first approximation.
